faculty.name: Dr. Patricia Glinton-Meicholas
faculty.title: President & Founder
faculty.bio: Dr. Glinton-Meicholas is a renowned Bahamian author, cultural advocate, and educational leader. With over 30 years of experience in education and cultural preservation, she founded CAPAS with a vision to bridge Caribbean heritage with contemporary creative education. She has authored numerous books on Bahamian folklore and culture.
education: Ph.D. in Cultural Studies, University of Miami
M.A. in Education, University of The Bahamas
B.A. in English Literature, College of The Bahamas
achievements: Author of 12 published books on Bahamian culture
Founding Director of National Arts Festival

faculty.name: Prof. Antonius Roberts
faculty.title: Director of Creative Arts
faculty.bio: Professor Roberts is an internationally acclaimed Bahamian artist and educator whose contemporary works have been exhibited in galleries across the Caribbean, United States, and Europe. He brings a unique perspective that merges traditional Bahamian artistic traditions with modern contemporary art practices.
education: M.F.A. in Visual Arts, Virginia Commonwealth University
Certificate in Art Education, College of The Bahamas
publications: Contemporary Bahamian Art: A New Perspective (2021)

faculty.name: Dr. Sarah Thompson
faculty.title: Head of Technology Division
faculty.bio: Dr. Thompson is a computer science pioneer in the Caribbean region, specializing in educational technology and digital innovation. She has led numerous initiatives to integrate cutting-edge technology with creative education, making CAPAS a leader in tech-enhanced learning.
education: M.S. in Educational Technology, Stanford University
B.S. in Computer Engineering, University of Florida
publications: Digital Innovation in Small Island States (2022)

faculty.name: Prof. Marcus Williams
faculty.title: Director of Performing Arts
faculty.bio: Professor Williams is a master musician, composer, and cultural preservationist who has dedicated his career to maintaining and evolving Bahamian musical traditions. His expertise in Junkanoo, rake and scrape, and contemporary music production makes him a unique voice in Caribbean music education.
education: M.M. in Music Composition, Juilliard School
B.M. in Music Performance, Berklee College of Music
Certificate in Caribbean Music Studies, University of the West Indies
achievements: Grammy nomination for Caribbean Music Album 2021
Bahamas Music Hall of Fame inductee
Composer of official Bahamas 50th Independence anthem

faculty.name: Dr. Elena Rodriguez
faculty.title: Professor of Marine Biology
faculty.bio: Dr. Rodriguez is a leading marine biologist specializing in Caribbean coral reef ecosystems. Her research on sustainable marine practices and climate change adaptation has influenced policy throughout the region. She brings environmental awareness into all aspects of CAPAS education.
education: Ph.D. in Marine Biology, University of Miami
M.S. in Environmental Science, Florida International University
B.S. in Biology, University of Puerto Rico
achievements: Environmental Policy Advisor to Bahamas Government
publications: Coral Reefs of the Bahamas: A Conservation Guide (2023)
Climate Change Impacts on Caribbean Marine Life (2022)

faculty.name: Prof. James McCartney
faculty.title: Director of Business Studies
faculty.bio: Professor McCartney brings extensive experience in tourism and hospitality management to CAPAS. His expertise in sustainable business practices and cultural tourism has helped shape the curriculum to prepare students for leadership roles in the Bahamas' primary industries.
education: M.B.A. in Hospitality Management, Cornell University
B.S. in Business Administration, Florida State University
Certificate in Sustainable Tourism, University of the West Indies
achievements: Former General Manager of 5-star resort chain
Tourism Board Strategic Planning Committee member
publications: Sustainable Tourism in Small Island States (2022)
